title: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil usage issue in win32
description: Bug 21706 - BidiUtil usage issue in win32
OB: When using the Class.forName() method in the org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil class on win32, a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown, which is not defined in the CLDC class libraries. This causes an issue in the CLDC version of SWT. The problem can be observed when using jxeLink or similar tools. The Eclipse compiler and Sun's compiler do not raise any compiler errors for this issue.
EB: The usage of Class.forName() in the BidiUtil class on win32 should be changed to remove the reflection.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Run the code on win32 with the CLDC version of SWT.
2. Verify or use jxeLink or similar tools.
3. Observe that a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown due to the usage of Class.forName() in the BidiUtil class.

Expected behavior:
The code should not throw a NoClassDefFoundError when using Class.forName() in the BidiUtil class on win32.
